main event: A civilian reported a ground-visual UFO sighting in Lutz, Florida on 22 June 1956. The object was described as round, about the size of a half dollar held at arm's length, with an orange color and a reddish bottom.
interesting points: The sighting was thought to be a planet (Saturn) by the reporting officer.
No photographs were included in the report.
The observation was made with the naked eye and then with binoculars.
The report mentions the passing of several aircraft in the vicinity during the observation.
A navigator, Major Novak, was requested to observe the UFO and reported it as definitely a planet, presumed to be Saturn.
sighted object: one round, orange UFO with a reddish bottom
